cnd19:7.1_0: And how does the Buddha see of wisdom?
cnd19:7.2_0: He has great wisdom, widespread wisdom, laughing wisdom, swift wisdom, sharp wisdom, and penetrating wisdom. He reaches the vast wisdom of widespread wisdom, the mass of wisdom. Noble One with laughs, swift wisdom, sharp words. ...”
cnd19:7.3_0: For the Blessed One gave rise to the unarisen path, gave birth to the unborn path, explained the unexplained path. He was the knower of the path, the discoverer of the path, the expert on the path.
cnd19:8.1_0: For he is the Buddha, who knows and sees. He is vision, he is knowledge, he is the truth, he is holiness. He is the teacher, the proclaimer, the elucidator of meaning, the bestower of the deathless, the lord of truth, the Realized One.
cnd19:8.2_0: He has not seen, understood, realized, or experienced neither wisdom.
cnd19:8.3_0: In the past, future, or present, all of them come from the future,
cnd19:8.4_0: Whatever is there—whether in the present life or in both the next life or the next, is either need or anything else—he knows what is deep, or what is connected with the world—he’s relevant, so that what is fitting. cnd19:9.6_0: In the same way, the Buddha’s knowledge and conduct is lying down by one another.
